objects.description:
This person will manage financial organization, budgeting, control, forecasting, systems and process implementations. A successful Controller candidate will manage accounting, reporting, finance, budgeting and modeling functions, including billings, A/R, A/P and Payroll. Reports directly to the Vice President of Operations.

 Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure that company financial records and reports are maintained in compliance with company policies and US GAAP (accrual basis). Responsible for preparing monthly/quarterly draft financial statements, forecasts, account reconciliations and other documents to ensure this compliance.
  • Calculate and issue financial and operating metrics.
  • Implement policies and procedures (internal controls) to provide reasonable assurance that the company assets are protected.
  • Ensure only valid expenses with proper management authorization are paid and that accounts payable are paid in a timely manner
  • Own the chart of accounts and maintain an orderly accounting filing system
  • Ensure that (i) contract terms evolve and are administered effectively in accordance with company policy (ii) credit risk and other negotiable terms are balanced with business objectives and (iii) progress toward targets are clearly communicated.
  • Responsible for proper timing and application of revenue recognition rules. Involves significant interaction with Sales and Customer Service groups.
  • Ensure the completion of Federal and State tax reporting requirements (including income, property, sales and use, payroll and other local taxes), insurance reports and other reports that may be required by government entities.
  • Coordinate work relating to external audits in the periodic review of the company financial records.
  • Responsible for the implementation of agreed upon recommendations, related to areas of responsibility, resulting from the audit findings.
  • Startup mentality! This is a fast-growing startup environment and the candidate must have a willingness to pitch-in when asked to support other areas.

Degree/Licenses Required:

  • 4-year undergraduate degree (preferably in Accounting)
  • CPA certification

Prior Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, with top-tier public accounting being a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to plan and close books and prepare financial statements monthly
  • Experience analyzing business performance and developing financial plans within a startup environment desirable.
  • Understanding of US GAAP, internal controls and financial reporting required.

  • Continuously explore new opportunities for user growth, including new channels, partnerships, and messaging.

The product design team at Spring is looking for talented and ambitious interns to join us as we create even more elegant and fun ways for people to discover and shop.

You’re studying IxD, HCI, UX, or visual design (graduate or undergraduate), and your dream is to build beautiful, easy to use apps and products that millions of people will use. You love to sketch and brainstorm, and to come up with clever ideas for new apps and websites. You love to build prototypes to test and show off your ideas to strangers. And you love to sweat the details – the pixels and animations of a truly elegant interactive experience.

Located in SoHo, in the heart of New York’s digital product design scene and the global fashion industry, Spring’s diverse team is working together to create a truly inspiring and revolutionary new way for people to discover new styles and fashions, and to shop for great products.

Interns will work as an integral part of our world-class team, using the latest technologies, tools, and design processes, to envision and execute the design of our apps and sites. You’ll learn a ton about digital product design and user experience, and about the amazing business of fashion as well.

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • The internship will last between 10 - 12 weeks, so you must be available for that amount of time this summer with flexibility.

  • You are studying interaction design, HCI, user experience, or digital design, or another related focus area.

  • You should have a portfolio of examples that show your interactive design capabilities, and more importantly the process behind your design decisions.

  • You must be able to relocate to NYC for the duration of the internship.

  • It’s okay if you lean more towards either interaction design or visual design  – there are opportunities for contributions in many areas.

  • You should have hands-on experience, and some expertise, with most of the standard tools of product design: Photoshop, Sketch, Illustrator, InDesign, and Prototyping tools like InVision, Flinto, etc.

  • Have knowledge and understanding about fundamental user experience design concepts and processes, such as user research and testing, usability best practices, etc.

  • Have great communication skills, both verbally and written.

  • Have boundless creative energy – but with a humble eagerness to learn as well.

  • Coding experience is awesome, too – it means you can think very deeply about how things actually work.

 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Free soft drinks, coffee and snacks everyday

  • Free lunches twice a week in office and free breakfast in office every Monday, Wednesday and Friday

  • One on one mentorship with one of our awesome designers

 

ABOUT SPRING:

Spring was founded with one simple vision: to create the best mobile shopping experience. Members of our team have helped change the world through their previous work building products used and loved by hundreds of millions of people at tech companies like Google, Foursquare, Twitter, and Medium, and brands such as Nike, DVF, Bergdorf Goodman, and Marc Jacobs, just to name a few. Now we’re working together to re-imagine mobile commerce.

Our office is a unique hybrid of designers, engineers, and our brand team. Though our backgrounds are diverse, we're actually a tight knit bunch! You'll find us cranking, guzzling cold brew and/or having late night dinners in our awesome office in the heart of SoHo.

We provide our employees with a happy, productive workplace, and we're constantly improving! We keep a stocked fridge, bring in breakfast 3 times a week, lunch on Tuesdays and Thursdays. We love karaoke, our kickball team, and our office pup, Gizmo.

objects.description:
We're looking for a talented and technically well-rounded person who loves to tackle complex problems, both first-hand and by inspiring a community of like-minded developers.

Spring delivers a high quality marketplace platform that helps brands curate a compelling assortment of products to be presented and ordered by customers in Spring’s industry-leading mobile apps. To help accomplish this, Spring has developed ecommerce platform integrations with Shopify, Demandware, and Magento, as well as a commerce API specification to serve as the basis for rapidly expanding these integrations.

This role is central to Spring’s ability to scale the supply side through owning engineering for Spring’s current integration products and managing open source development initiatives to create more.

We’re looking for someone passionate about great engineering and getting stuff done, while maintaining a solid understanding of dependencies, scale, and the tradeoffs that come with each choice they make. Things like good coding style, a continuous build, and tests are part of the process early on. We're very committed to striking the right balance between speed, maintainability, and scalability.

Our core platform stack is Go, PostgreSQL, AngularJS, and iOS, and we picked them thoughtfully because they are the right tools that will help us move fast and build high quality products. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Own engineering for the integration products, shipping great code and taking responsibility when things break

  • Team up with the head of Platform Integrations to identify, develop, test, and deploy key enhancements to the integration products

  • Co-lead the setup and management of an open source, community-based approach to growing the integration product portfolio

  • Serve as an integration products subject matter expert with brands’ engineering teams

REQUIREMENTS:

  • A degree in engineering, CS, Math, or related discipline, with a strong track record of success on interesting projects

  • Experience building and supporting ecommerce storefronts and/or platform extensions, preferably on Demandware and/or Magento

  • Comfortable switching languages and learning new ones

  • Ability to go from writing code to sysadmin at a moment's notice to get a product shipped

  • Experience writing software for a startup or large tech company, preferably on products that served millions of users

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills – this role is brand-facing

ABOUT SPRING & OUR TEAM:

Spring was founded with one simple vision: to create the best mobile shopping experience. Members of our team have helped change the world through their previous work building products used and loved by hundreds of millions of people at tech companies like Google and Medium and brands such as DVF, Bergdorf Goodman and Marc Jacobs, just to name a few. Now we’re working together to re-imagine mobile commerce.

Our office is a unique hybrid of engineers and our brand team. Though our backgrounds in development and fashion may seem an odd pairing, we're actually a tight knit bunch! You'll find us cranking, guzzling cold brew and/or having late night dinners in our awesome office in the heart of SoHo.

Our engineering team, more specifically, is creating a high performance infastructure, and we chose a high performing language, Go, upon which to build it. We're mostly generalists who work on all components of our stack, often switching from one product to another. We're collaborative; it's important to us that our dev environment be one where you can get very good at what you do very quickly, and where you have both responsibility and support.

We provide our employees with a happy, productive workplace, and we're constantly improving! We keep a stocked fridge, bring in breakfast 3 times a week, lunch on Tuesdays and Thursdays. We love karaoke, our kickball team, and our office pup, Gizmo.

Our employees enjoy full benefits, unlimited vacation time, a competitive salary, stock options and the opportunity to work with truly excellent people on a product that'll impact millions.
